why would you sudo ssh? (only reason i can think of is that you are using auth_keys and the private key is in /root/.ssh

sudo ssh is a weird thing to do, because you (usually) care about the permissions on the remote side not on the local side. why do you care that root@localhost is sending commands to the other machine vs username@localhost. what matters is if root@remotehost is executing the commands or not
